articles.author: Nandita Bose, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Trump also asserted that Musk's blistering attacks on the bill were motivated by the proposed elimination of consumer tax credits for electric vehicles.
articles.title: Trump attacks Musk as public feud escalates over tax-cut bill

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The move is retaliation over the war tribunal's probe into alleged war crimes by U.S. troops in Afghanistan and over an arrest warrant for Israel's Netanyahu.
articles.title: Trump administration imposes sanctions on four ICC judges in unprecedented move

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Reuters video showed smoke billowing from the area after the first strikes on the Hezbollah stronghold in over a month.
articles.title: Israeli military strikes Beirut's southern suburbs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military recovered the bodies of two hostages, Judi Weinstein-Haggai and Gad Haggai, who were held by Hamas, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli military recovers bodies of two hostages held by Hamas, prime minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and U.S. President Donald Trump are in direct communication as part of Ottawa's bid to persuade Washington to lift tariffs, Industry Minister Melanie Joly said on Thursday.
articles.title: Trump and Carney are in direct contact over tariffs, says Canadian minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday held talks with U.S. President Donald Trump by phone, China's state-run news agency Xinhua reported, as bilateral relations have been strained by trade disputes.
articles.title: Xi, Trump hold phone talks, Xinhua reports

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Nandita Bose
articles.description: The proclamation fully restricts the entry of nationals from 12 countries including Afghanistan, Haiti and Iran. The entry of people from seven other countries will be partially restricted.
articles.title: Trump bans nationals from 12 countries, citing security concerns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Hamas in Gaza, Khalil al-Hayya, said in a pre-recorded speech on Thursday the group had not rejected the latest U.S. proposal for a ceasefire with Israel but demanded changes that would secure the end of the war in the enclave.
articles.title: Hamas chief says group did not reject US ceasefire proposal for Gaza, sought changes

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: The fate of roughly $22 billion worth of SpaceX's government contracts is at risk and multiple U.S. space programs face looming changes in the fallout of a worsening fight between Elon Musk and U.S. President Donald Trump, an explosive breakup over the administration's spending bill.
articles.title: Musk-Trump breakup puts billions in SpaceX contracts at risk, jolting US space program

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drones attacked Ukraine's capital Kyiv early on Friday, triggering fires in residential buildings in different parts of the city, authorities said.
articles.title: Russian drones attack Kyiv, trigger fires in residential areas, officials say
